wikipedia_page.main: George Andrew Lake (1889 – 6 November 1918) was an English professional football left half who made one appearance in the Football League for Chelsea.

response: Lake George or George Lake may refer to:
*George Lake (Nunavut), the location of George Lake Aerodrome, Nunavut
*George Lake (Missoula County, Montana), a lake in Missoula County, Montana
*George Lake (Park County, Montana), a lake in Park County, Montana
*George Lake Aerodrome, a privately owned ice runway located on George Lake, Nunavut, Canada
*St. George Lake, a lake in Waldo County, Maine

Thompson worked as a putter and stoneman at Emma Colliery, Ryton. He enlisted as a private in the Scots Guards in February 1917, during the First World War. Two months later, his brother Charlton was killed in France while serving with the Durham Light Infantry. Thompson was involved in the Battle of the Sambre-Oise Canal on 4 November 1918, and was killed in action at Bermeries two days later, just five days before the armistice. He was one of the two last English footballers to die in the war, dying on the same day as George Lake. He was buried in Bermeries Communal Cemetery.
